column4: You notice an impetuous slogan burnt into the wall here.

column4: A brisk wind messes your hair.

column8: The overwhelming sound of howling winds envelop you and is only getting louder and louder.

column39:
MEANDERING STEAM VENT
Calcified crawlspace. Boiling haze. Barely breathable.
column40:
SULFUROUS HOT SPRINGS
Terrassed natural pools of turquoise water. Faint smell of rotten egg. Dripping noise. Light haze.
column41:
SIZZLING VOLCANIC POOL
Boiling dark water. 3-feet deep. Big boulder in the middle. Dull red glow. Hissing. Sweating walls.


Enough gems at the bottom to fill a purse.
column42:
MAGICAL STEAM ENGINE
Spherical bronze room. Doors at different height linked by iron ladders and walkways. Echo. Multiple bronze pipes.
1 steam elemental.

1 elemental binding orb.
column43:
PILLAR OF CLOUDS
200 feet high. Slippery wet floating marble platforms. Rumbling thunder and low visibility.
1 AERIAL SERVANT.
column44:
GATE TO THE PLANE OF STEAM
Perfectly circular arch of rune stones. Blue portal spewing huge clouds. Glistening wet floor. Unbearable temperature.
2 STEAM ELEMENTALS.

column4: You hear the distinct sound of a faraway hawk.
column5: You find a hawk feather.
column6: There's a tiny dot far ahead in the sky. It must be a bird.
column7: A small rodent falls from the sky. It is dead.
column8: You are startled by the distinctive screech of an hawk.

column39:
WINDSWEPT CLIFF
Climbable but hard. Stunted shrubs. Bones at the bottom.
column40:
THIN TALL SPIRE
Eighty feet. Wind-eroded sandstone. Gorgeous panorama. Vertigo inducing. Sky dome.
1 hawk.

1D6 hawk eggs.
column41:
DESOLATED OUTCROP
Rocky open space. Rodent borrows. Clean air.
column42:
GIANT SPIRE
One-hundred and fifty feet. Wind-eroded sandstone. Gorgeous panorama. Vertigo inducing. Twig and bones nest.
1 giant hawk.

1D6 giant hawk eggs.
column43:
NARROW CLIFFSIDE PATH
Eighty feet above and below. Falling Pebbles. Infrequent bird shrieks in the sky.

Rock fall.
column44:
HIGHEST PEAK
Two-hundred feet climb. Weathered adventurer bones. Above the clouds. Howling winds.
1D4 giant hawk.

1 bag of gems.

column6: Heavy foot tracks lead deeper ahead.

HALLOWED HALL
Stern statuary. Echoey stone floor. Massive doors.
column40:
OSTENTATIOUS BARRACKS
Heraldic banners ; Simple sturdy bunk beds; Utilitarian weapon racks.
1 sleeping and 1 praying knight.

1D6 silver coin purses and 1D4 weapons.
column41:
ROYAL BANQUET
Heraldic banners and ornate torches. Long tables full of juicy leftovers. Barrels of wine. Wooden throne.

2 tapestries worth a bag of gold.
column42:
COMMAND CENTER
Giant regional map. Marble figurines. Sturdy desk. Framed royal edicts.
1D4 knights.

One chest full of silver coins.
column43:
DRAW BRIDGE
Dungeon-appropriate moat. Proud banners. Observation deck. Alarm bell.

One taunting guard if daytime. One sleepy guard if nightime.
column44:
SANCTIFIED RELIQUARY
Striking stained glass rosette. Marble knight tomb. Melting candle crust.
1 greater divine servant.

1 magic item.

ONCE WAS A SHRINE
Scattered sandstone; Long-gone roof framing the sky; Eroded marble busts; Dusty piles of old and new trash


1 random weapon and 2 extra scroungedthings.
column40:
ONCE WAS A TOWER
Was 4 stories high but has no floors now; Guano-crusted horizontal support beams; Foul trash heaps; no roof.
2D6 harpies.

2 random weapons and 4 extra scroungedthings.
column41:
ONCE WAS A KING
Rancid smell of piss and garbage. Long stone banquet table crumbling under trash heaps. Vandalized throne.
1D8 harpies.

1 crown worth a bag of gold and 2 extra scroungedthings.
column42:
ONCE WAS A GARDEN
Brown and dry. Gravel paths. Heaps of Trash.


4 scroungedthings.
column43:
SUN-DRIED CLIFF
Desperatly clinging shrubbery. 100' high. Scorching wind.
2D6 harpies.

PARLIAMENT OF GUANO
Unbearable smell. Natural amphitheatre. Big twig nests up and down.
4D6 harpies

1 magical item and 1 bag of gems.

column39:
WIDE RIVER SECTION
Cacophony of birds; Bone-white driftwood; Lazy and muddy.
Bountiful with fishes.
column40:
GIANT SUNKEN WILLOW
Seductive curtains of leaves; Summertime heat; Branches like wet hair. Acrid and humid air.
2 sleeping swarms of Olitiau bats.
column41:
DUSTY GOAT PEN
Neglected wooden fence. Persistent flies. Ramshackle loafing shed.
2D6 starving goats. 1 dying from olitiau venoms.
column42:
MANGROVE MAZE
Waist-high calm water. Taunting canopy monkeys. Roots like spider legs.
1D6 death's head fruits.

Machete and bones of a lost adventurer.
column43:
TREETRUNK RIVER BRIDGE
Slippery mud cliffs (80''); Creeping bark moss; Bristle shrubbery.
Save or collapse.

Dead miner with a bag of gold nuggets at the bottom.
column44:
RIVERSIDE CAVE
Dripping wet clay. Hairy roots. Pungent smell of guano.
1D6 sleeping swarms of olitiau bats.

Magical spring that has the effect of a random potion.

column39:
HERETICAL IDOL
Grotesque posture. Apocalyptic mural. Festering offerings. Echoes of chanting. Curses whoever does not know the password.
column40:
ASCETIC DORMITORY
Threadbare stacked beds; Candel-lit silent alcoves; Utilitarian clay pots.

Denizens: 1D6 sleeping and 1 praying CULTISTS.

Loot: 1D6 copper coin purses and 1D4 vestments.
column41:
SINISTER PANTRY
Pungent amphors. Netted cheese wheels. Decaying limbs. Scurrying rats.

Loot: 1D6 rations of suspicious origin (50% each be carrying ghoul rabies.
column42:
TORTURE CHAMBER
Bolted chains; Blood-caked slabs; Festering rags.

Denizens: 1D6 captives.

Loot: 1D6 cruel weapons.
column43:
TRIAL OF THE FAITHFUL
Ember Carpet; Ominous gong; Watcheful Eye.

Denizens: 1 solemn CULTIST.
column44:
BLASPHEMOUS CHAPEL
Solemn pews; Oozing candles; Summoning circle.

Denizens: 3D6 chanting CULTISTS & 1 screaming ABYSSAL HULK.

Loot: 1D6 precious grotesque idols.

column4: The pungent smell of incense permeates everything.
column5: A weird occult symbol is engraved on a surface. It is barely visible.
column6: Occult markings seem to lead deeper into the dungeon.
column7: A ritually killed creature propped in the center of the room.
column8: The discordant chanting of 2D4 cultists can be heard in the next room.
column32: CULTISTS worshipping voices in their dreams
column36: DREAM CULTISTS driving mad those who know too much
column37: friendly DREAM CULTISTS
column39:
HERETICAL IDOL
Grotesque posture. Apocalyptic mural. Festering offerings. Echoes of chanting. Curses whoever does not know the password.
column40:
ASCETIC DORMITORY
Threadbare stacked beds; Candel-lit silent alcoves; Utilitarian clay pots.

Denizens: 1D6 sleeping and 1 praying CULTISTS.

Loot: 1D6 copper coin purses and 1D4 vestments.
column41:
SINISTER PANTRY
Pungent amphors. Netted cheese wheels. Decaying limbs. Scurrying rats.

Loot: 1D6 rations of suspicious origin (50% each be carrying ghoul rabies.
column42:
TORTURE CHAMBER
Bolted chains; Blood-caked slabs; Festering rags.

Denizens: 1D6 captives.

Loot: 1D6 cruel weapons.
column43:
TRIAL OF THE FAITHFUL
Ember Carpet; Ominous gong; Watcheful Eye.

Denizens: 1 solemn CULTIST.
column44:
BLASPHEMOUS CHAPEL
Solemn pews; Oozing candles; Summoning circle.

Denizens: 3D6 chanting CULTISTS & 1 screaming ABYSSAL HULK.

Loot: 1D6 precious grotesque idols.

column4: A wicker effigy is ominously hanging. Was it there before?
column5: A pig rummages through the room. It is wearing a torn piece of human clothing.
column6: The sweet smell of pies leads deeper in the dungeon.
column7: A single children shoe lies on the floor as if recently dropped.
column8: A woman's coarse cackling can be heard from beyon this room. It is getting closer.
column32: a children-eating HAG
column33: a HAG selling cursed potions to desperate people
column34: three HAG SISTERS that can predict the future
column35: a wise yet cruel HAG in a roving chicken hut
column36: a mysterious OLD WOMAN protecting a village from calamity
column37: a WISE WOMAN that can cure all illnesses
column39:
WEAVER'S WORKSHOP
Creaking spinning wheel. Disturbing half-finished tapestry of your demise. Colourful yarn mounds.

Denizens: Numerous CATS.

Loot: 1D6 yarn balls made of children hair.
column40:
COTTAGE BEDROOM
Horrid handwoven bedding. Cozy hearth. Fluttering moths. Decapitated head arts and craft.

Denizens: 1 RUG OF SMOTHERING.

Loot: Roll on the hag loot table twice.
column41:
WELL-STOCKED PANTRY
Giant cured meat. Cooling savoury pies. Bloated flour bags.

Denizens: 1 sleeping child in a barrel.

Loot: 1D6 enchanted rations (save or sleep 24h).
column42:
COZY GARDEN
Sprawling vines. Bulbous gourds. Freshly turned earth.

Denizens: 1 STRANGLING VINE.

Loot: Bones and arrows from a local hunter.
column43:
NEGLECTED BASEMENT
Barren dust floor. Dark and still atmosphere. Countless hand-prints on the walls.

Denizens: 1D6 stunned villagers. Soulless. Facing walls.
column44:
JUMBLED KITCHEN
Maze of jars and pots. Hung dried animals. Cozy heat. Alarming smell. Boiling giant cauldron.

Denizens: 1 HAG.

Loot: Roll on the hag loot table six times.

column4: A dead fish stinking the place.
column5: A fish swims in a rivulet crossing the space.
column6: A swarm of fishing birds nests here.
column7: A school of fish quivers in a deep pool.
column8: The room is flooded. There is movement in the water. It is coming towards you.
column32: glutonous GIANT FISHES
column36: ugly GIANT FISHES that love polluted waters
column37: a sacred GIANT FISH
column39:
TRANQUIL LAKE
Opaque brown water. Droning insects. Occasional splashes.

Denizens: 2 scared FISH SWARMS and 1 hungry GIANT FISH.

Loot: 1 bag full gold coins at the bottom.
column40:
SEAWEED FOREST
Swaying semitransluscent kelp. Echoing pebble. Silence.

Denizens: 2 swirling FISH SWARM and 1 crawling CRAB SWARM.

Loot: 1 tangled weapon and clusters of eggs.
column41:
SHELLFISH ROCK
Barnacled. Extremely sharp. Emerging from the deep dark frigid water.

Denizens: 2 CRAB SWARMS.

Loot: 1D4 barnacled marble sculptures.
column42:
DERELICT FERRY CROSSING
Reed-lined river; Rotting boardwalk; Knee-deep mud; Rope linking two derelict docks; Small grey rowboat; No oars.

Denizens: 1 hiding GIANT FISH.
column43:
UNDERWATER TUNNEL
Naturally carved; takes 8 rounds to swim through; Deeply dark.
column44:
FLOODED CISTERN
Rows of ancient stone pillars. Deep and dark water. Wrecked rowboats. Echo.

Denizens: 1 angressive GIANT FISH.

column4: Dead bodies are piled in a corner. Rotting.
column5: An empty open grave.
column6: The stench of rotten flesh from further ahead makes you reek.
column7: A twitching severed hand rotting on the floor.
column8: Moans and the sound of slow laborious footsteps echo from behind. It is getting closer.
column32: diseased ZOMBIES
column36: people infected ZOMBIE PLAGUE seeking a cure
column37: an enslaved caste of ZOMBIES
column39:
OVERFLOWING MASS GRAVE
Revolting smell. Bloated gore. Feasting maggots.

Denizens: 2 plagued RAT SWARMS.

Loot: Scavenging through the pile for 10 minutes yields family jewels worth a purse of silver coins. Can be done 4 times.
column40:
NEGLECTED MORTUARY
Piles of cheap wooden coffins. Supressed smell of death. Ominous silence.

Denizens: 2D6 inert ZOMBIES inside awake if the coffins are opened.

Loot: 1 coil of 60' rope & a crowbar.
column41:
ABANDONNED BARRICADED ROOM
Bashed barricaded door. Broken wooden table and chairs. Spilled rotten food.
column42:
SILENT MORGUE
4 slabs. 2 with a covered body. 1 with bloody footsteps walking away from it. Cold temperature.

Loot: 1 medicine kit.
column43:
DERELICT ZOMBIE PENS
Room split by a ramshacke wall of wooden scraps. Rusting padlock. Multiple moans from behind.

Denizens: 4D6 ZOMBIES will break the wall in 1D4 turns if noise is made.
column44:
CURSED DIRT PATH
Long. Door at the end (locked). Innocuous silence. Smell of dewy dirt.

Denizens: 1D4 ZOMBIES burst from the ground each turn a living creature is in the room.

column4: A broken canopic jar.
column5: A big sandstone statue of a forgotten queen.
column6: Ancient hieroglyphs forbid you from going deeper.
column7: An old tomb robber skeleton cleanly cut in half on the vertical axis lies on the floor.
column8: All torches in the room are suddenly lit.
column32: the ETERNAL TOMB GUARDS of an ancient king
column33: the ETERNAL TOMB GUARDS of an ancient queen
column34: the unflinching GUARDS of an ancient tomb
column36: scattered immobile TOMB GUARDS protecting a kingdom that no longer exists
column37: stoic NECROPOLIS GUARDS
column39:
ANCIENT TOMB CORRIDOR
Hieroglyphic murals. Sandstone false pillars. Shroud of dust.

Denizens: 2 dormant TOMB GUARDS will activate on your second passage.
column40:
SAND-FILLED ROOM
Half drowned with sand. Low ceiling. Only the heads of 4 statues are visible.

Loot: A golden statue worth a bag of gold coins is buried at the bottom.
column41:
GRAVE ROBBER CAMP
Bedroll. Brasier. Wooden chest.

Loot: Ink and sheet. Scholarly books translating the local ancient language.
column42:
TOMB OF THE SERVANTS
Rows upon rows of terracotta statues holding labourer tools. Mural depicting slave labour and ancient kings.
column43:
ANCIENT FALSE TOMB
Enshrined stone sarcophagus. Long dried offerings. Hoard of canopic jars and ushabtis.

Denizens: 1D4 CENTIPEDE SWARMS in the empty sarcophagus & 2 dormant TOMB GUARDS will wake up if it is open.
column44:
ANCIENT DUSTY TOMB
Enshrined stone sarcophagus. Long dried offerings. Hoard of canopic jars and ushabtis.

Denizens: 1 dormant MUMMY in the sarcophagus & 2 dormant TOMB GUARDS will wake up if it is open.

Loot: Enough golden trinkets to fill a chest.
